even laozi was a foodie now i love
chinese cruising the most and of course
i might be a little biased but i think
what makes chinese cuisine really
special is that if you travel across
china you will find different dishes
different food items as you travel
across each single province of course
china has enjoyed a rather long history
of development in culinary arts and has
formed several distinct regional styles
which have been passed down through
generations of master chefs so in this
video i want to introduce you guys to
the five regions of china where the most
influential chinese cuisines come from
number one citron cuisine this is the
favorite type of cuisine for spice
lovers such as myself also let me know
in the comments below if you love spicy
food as much as i do now citron cuisine
carries strong local characteristics and
mainly comprises of ingredients from
chongqing chengdu northern and southern
tron regions sichuan cuisine employs
close to 40 different techniques in its
preparation including but not limited to
braising basting dry steaming oil
dripping and different kinds of frying
including stir fry pan fried deep fried
quick fry dry stir fry and soft fry
citron cuisine pays particular attention
to balancing the flavors and regards
flavor as its foundation the six basic
flavors of citron cuisine are tingly
spicy hot spicy sweet salty tangy and
bitter more flavors are produced through
the combination of two or more of the
basic flavors which can achieve 24 basic
flavors the most among all chinese
cuisines number two shandong cuisine
chandon cuisine also called the way or
loo cuisine is the earliest and most
influential cuisine in china in the mean
and qing dynasties many royal courtiers
came from shandong province to the
imperial palace and with them came their
recipes and their mom's recipes and
their grandma's recipes eventually
shendong dishes rose to ultimate
recognition in beijing which was the
capital of several co-existing dynasties
at the time beijing had no cuisine to
call his own since most of the chefs in
the king's imperial kitchen were shendon
master chefs during this period shandong
cuisine enjoyed great achievements
inside the imperial kitchen it has the
most variety of food styles and cooking
methods and its dishes are known for
their salty savory flavor as well as
tender and crispy textures shandong is
situated on the shandon peninsula and
because it lies along the yellow sea
with rich inland plains and four very
distinctive seasons seafood water
produce grains poultry fruits and
vegetables wild birds and animals are
abundant shandong chefs are well-rounded
in their skills and are famous for their
ball and the top methods of cooking ball
is a quick stir fry in high heat and
like the scholar remove from the qing
dynasty said quick stir fry the food in
boiling oil add in the spices and it's
done if it's extremely crispy then it's
done right ball is usually done
instantaneously the nutrients are well
preserved and the food is light and not
greasy thai is a unique cooking method
in shandong the main ingredients are
spiced and starched and then toff fried
and simmered in soup or sauce for
example guadalfu or wakata tofu is a
very traditional and popular shandong
dish number three my sort of nemesis
cantonese cuisine this is probably the
most popular type of chinese food here
in the us as there are many cantonese
word cantonese influenced restaurants
here and sorry this is like i said
probably my least favorite cuisine
because cantonese dishes have the
lightest taste compared with other
chinese cuisines and i'm a very sauce
heavy spicy meat in every single dish
type of guy you know maybe i should get
a t-shirt made that says that anyway
cantonese cuisine is known for its wide
use of fresh ingredients and creativity
cantonese chefs are great at adjusting
dishes according to seasonal and
climatic changes for example cantonese
summer and fall dishes taste lighter
while the winter and spring dishes are
richer and zestier cantonese cuisine
originates from guangdong province and
is made up of cuisines from three
principal areas guangzhou
zhou and dongjiang since the han and wei
dynasty guangzhou also called canton has
been a major port city in southern china
it is situated in the subtropics
bordering on the south china sea where
rainfall is abundant and the area is
rich in produce fresh seafood and
delicacies year-round which helped to
shape the freshness and natural light
flavoring that cantonese cuisine is
known for number four huay young cuisine
the huayon style of cooking emphasizes
material selection and uses more sugar
than other chinese cuisines it is known
for its meticulous preparation process
and fine balance between rich flavor and
pure taste huayian cuisine focuses on
preserving the original flavors of the
produce and specializes in braising
stewing roasting and boiling these
methods bring out the original flavor of
the ingredients huay on dishes borrow
fresh crispy and tender qualities from
southern china and incorporate savory
color and richness from the north as a
result this cuisine is well liked by
both southerners and northerners except
for me because i find the dishes way too
sweet but soup dumplings that i like
huay young cuisine is derived from the
native cooking styles of the region
surrounding the lower reaches of the
hawaii and yangtze river hence the name
and centers on the cities of yangzhou
and huayun in jiangsu province it
originated in the early qing dynasty and
gained national fame during the suey
dynasty and tong dynasty huay young
cuisine has had a profound impact on the
culinary culture in suzhou chile's
anghui and shanghai all of which quickly
took on their own characteristics and
finally number five northeastern cuisine
the cuisine of northeastern china refers
to the cuisines of jilin liaoning and
heilongjiang provinces and it has been
well known since ancient times it
originated from the teen dynasty during
the early 12th century due to the
extremely cold weather in the region
people are accustomed to eating
temperature wise very hot food and so
cooking techniques such as casserole hot
pot and roasting were developed
northeastern cuisine uses native crops
of this mountainous land and is famed
for its wild game dishes like rabbits
and boar knife skills and command of
fire and fire temperature are important
in its chef's training cooking
techniques make use of quick stir fry
over high heat stir fry over low heat
stewing barbecuing glazing and so on its
dishes are tender but not rare well done
but not tough northeastern recipes are
typically very rich and the dishes are
full of sauce flavor and very
substantial so there you go guys those
are the five regions where the most
influential chinese cuisines come from

really had
